newsitem.title: UK: Reckitt & Colman jumps on dividend news.
newsitem.headline: Reckitt & Colman jumps on dividend news.

text.p: Shares in Reckitt & Colman Plc rose in early trading on Tuesday after the household products group said it planned a special foreign income dividend of 35.65p per share, totalling 152 million stg.
The stock jumped on the news, adding 23-1/2p to 736-1/2p in the pre-market.
The company said it expected to continue to generate strong cash flows, exceeding its financing requirements for acquisitions in developing markets.
"The group is committed to optimising shareholder returns," said chairman Alan Dalby.
The company is also to ask shareholders to approve a share consolidation which will reduce the number of ordinary shares in issue by five percent.

Reckitt said that by the end of 1996 it expected to have reduced net debt by more than 450 million stg, largely from the sale of non-core businesses totalling 430 million stg. -- London Newsroom, +44 171 542 5106
